data.boring_theme: going to the petrol station to pump diesel into a vehicle
data.output: What happens when you put diesel into a petrol car? My friend and I decided to find out. He has a petrol car, and I a deisel one, and so we swopped fuels and strated the engine. We had to use our feet to pump the accelerator before anything happened. All seemed to be well, so we wondered why. It turned out we'd forgotten which car was which, and so each vehicle had its correct fuel.

data.boring_theme: putting a stamp on the envelop containing a letter to send it
data.output: I was angry. A great stamp of the feet. The first letter of my name had come out wrong on my new monogram logo. I'll have to send it back.

data.boring_theme: having an organ empire and complying with regulations
data.output: My favourire bodily organ is my right eye. With it, I can see the whole vista of the empire when I stand at the highest point of the island. The laws of optics suggest it shouldn't be so, but in magic worlds eyes don't have to comply with the laws of terrestial physics

data.boring_theme: the feeling of gloom you have about an existing payment
data.output: It was a dark and strmy night: Stygian gloom everywhere. My ATM card had been refused again - I wouldn't be able to make the cash payment the gang was demanding. There wasa gun to my head. I was sure I would be killed, and wondered what it was like to cease to exist.
